properties.name: 3rd stop on River loop. Union Pacific
properties.description: Posted by Whirlingdervish 3rd stop. Take W Riverfront to W 3rd crossing RR near major Union Pacific switch yard that once did major diesel engine overhaul. Go south on 3rd/Pike Avenue to River Road and West.

properties.name: 4th stop Old River Road
properties.description: Posted by Whirlingdervish This leg of the 20 mile loop is a 2 lane quiet road to old quarry. Almost rural like except it is across the river from the State Capitol

properties.name: Big Dam Bike Bridge
properties.description: Posted by Whirlingdervish North ramp of world\'s longest bike bridge across the top of Murray lock and dam. Central Arkansas cyclists and county Judge Buddy Villines pushed to make and close the 23 mile bike loop from downtown here. Otherwise, this would just be another lock and dam off a riverside drive and no bike loop.

properties.name: Burns Park Boat Ramp Parking
properties.description: Posted by Whirlingdervish Good place to park if one is exiting I-40 as the golf course and Burns park exit is well signed on interstate. Walk or bike across small bridge on east side. There, at the base of the bluff, one will find a mountain bike trail with a switch back trail up to the top at Emerald park. Otherwise stay on the senic, paved bike trail going along the base of the bluff. Best location if one wants to simply run or walk a couple of miles. 99% sure that nearby golf course is public.

properties.name: Emerald Park--on side loop
properties.description: Posted by Whirlingdervish Emerald Park is a large pine tree filled park overlooking the quarry and Little Rock State house capitol. To see the capitol building--looks identical to US capitol--take the more airy trail on a sheer spit of rock on the west side of the quarry. At about 200-300 feet above the quarry one can look both east and far west up the river. If you have a rugged bike there is a switch back trail on the west side of park returning to the river trail (bike trail is miss-named River Rd on Tela Atlas map)

properties.name: Exit to Fort Roots
properties.description: Posted by Whirlingdervish Late 19th century buildings on edge of this high bluff. It is adjacent to Emerald Park with park entrance at Pulaski Tech. Roots is also the grounds for a quiet VA hospital which can be bypassed on 1st street/

properties.name: Low Head Hydro Parking
properties.description: Posted by Whirlingdervish Best location for public parking off of I-430. Exit Crystal Hill road off I-430, take first right and along west side of new Industrial park, Public fishing. Low head hydro plant is a form of green energy not commonly found in central USA. North ramp of world\'s longest bike bridge then under construction across the dam--now completed. A senic view west toward Pinnacle Mountain and Cypress trees along river.

properties.name: Oxbow Pond side loop
properties.description: Posted by Whirlingdervish Haven\'t been on this side loop since the trail was created. However, it appears to loop part of the old river channel now a pond.

properties.name: Public Dirt Bike area
properties.description: Posted by Whirlingdervish Dirt bike area with several jumps. But, have not really looked into it. Only briefly observed a youth rally.

properties.name: Quarry exit on 20 mile loop
properties.description: Posted by Whirlingdervish Bay Oaks Dr ends in the old quarry from whose stones many old buildings in the downtown where built. Abandoned the quarry was sought by the local Quapaw indians as a ceremonial campground. Too bad it didn\'t happen. The pine stands and open quarry floor would have made an interesting tableau of indian singing and campfires as seen from the Emerald park heights above. An large model rail road society is located here across from the fraternal order of police\'s "clubhouse". In their warehouse like building the modelers have very large historical layouts of citys in Arkansas during the heights of the rail era. If you are luck someone will be around for your own tour of the private facility. The River Rd changes here to a paved bike trail in a senic winding loop along the bluff going toward I-30.

properties.name: Rebsamen west end parking
properties.description: Posted by Whirlingdervish This is the west end of the Little Rock riverside drive and bike trail. The bike trail, although paved, can be a little rough at times because of poor construction and ground heave. Nice but not as senic as northside of river.

properties.name: Riverfront Drive
properties.description: Posted by Whirlingdervish Rebsamen Park bike trail portion ends at end of Riverfront drive, a mostly 4 lane street with moderate to light traffic

properties.name: Start 23 mile bike loop.  Riverfront Parking
properties.description: Posted by Whirlingdervish

properties.name: USS Razorback submarine 2nd stop 20 mile river loop
properties.description: Posted by Whirlingdervish 2 rd stop. Old USS WWII submarine named after Arkansas Razorbacks
